Label: plant growth cycle
Text definition: A whole plant development stage that begins with seed germination or exit from dormancy, ends with death or entry into dormancy, and during which the participant plant is not dormant.
Comments: This class is not intended to apply to in vitro-grown plants such as tissue culture, where growth can begin with cell division.

Label: initial growth cycle
Text definition: A plant growth cycle that begins with seed germination.

Label: later growth cycle
Text definition: A plant growth cycle that begins with exit from dormancy of the participating plant. This cycle cannot begin with the exit from dormancy of a seed.

Label: plant regreening process
Notes: Need to request this in GO.

Label: phenology observing process
Text definition: A planned process that has as input  a whole plant and has as output a measurement datum that is a quality datum of some plant phenological trait.

Label: vascular leaf unfolding stage
Text definition: A vascular leaf expansion stage during which a vascular leaf participates in the process of unfolding.
Comments: This stage ends when a leaf is considered unfolded, which varies by species, but generally occurs once the leaf blade has unfolded enough to appear more or less like a small version of the adult leaf. For species with scaled buds, this is generally once the entire leaf blade has emerged from a breaking bud; for conifers, once a needle begins to spread away at an angle from the developing stem or from other needles in a bundle (e.g. pines); for grasses, once the leaf blade unrolls slightly from around the stem and begins to fall away at an angle; for sedges, once the leaf has grown long enough that the two halves of the blade have begun to spread apart like an open book; for rushes, once the exposed, green portion of the leaf has reached a specified length.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: vascular leaf expanding unfolded stage
Text definition: A vascular leaf expansion stage during which a vascular leaf has completed the process of unfolding but is still expanding in size.
Comments: This stage begins when a leaf is considered unfolded, which varies by species, but generally occurs once the leaf blade has unfolded enough to appear more or less like a small version of the adult leaf. For species with scaled buds, this is generally once the entire leaf blade has emerged from a breaking bud; for conifers, once a needle begins to spread away at an angle from the developing stem or from other needles in a bundle (e.g. pines); for grasses, once the leaf blade unrolls slightly from around the stem and begins to fall away at an angle; for sedges, once the leaf has grown long enough that the two halves of the blade have begun to spread apart like an open book; for rushes, once the exposed, green portion of the leaf has reached a specified length.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: vascular leaf expanded immature stage
Text definition: A vascular leaf post-expansion stage during which a vascular leaf has not yet completed the process of maturing.
Comments: In this stage, the leaf is fully expanded but not yet the same color and texture as fully mature leaves.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: vascular leaf mature stage
Text definition: A vascular leaf post-expansion stage during which a vascular leaf has completed the process of maturing.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: unopened flower stage
Text definition: A flower development stage in which a flower has not yet opened.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: open flower stage
Text definition: A flower development stage in which a flower has opened.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: pollen-releasing flower stage
Text definition: An open flower stage in which the anthers are releasing pollen.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: fruit unripe stage
Text definition: A fruit ripening stage in which the ripening fruit has not yet reached the fruit ripe stage.

Label: fruit ripe stage
Text definition: A fruit ripening stage in which the ripening fruit has completed ripening to the taxon-specific point at which it is widely considered by botanical experts to have seeds that are developed enough to be ready for dispersal, or, in the case of agricultural crops, the point at which the fruit is considered palatable for human consumption.

Label: strobilus development stage
Text definition: A reproductive shoot system development stage that has as primary participant a strobilus.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: microsporangiate strobilus ripening stage
Text definition: A strobilus development  that has as primary participant a microsporangiate strobilus (pollen cone).

Label: open microsporangiate strobilus stage
Text definition: A microsporangiate strobilus (pollen cone) ripening stage during the pollen cone is open.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: pollen-releasing microsporangiate strobilus stage
Text definition: A open microsporangiate strobilus (pollen cone) stage during the pollen cone is releasing pollen.
Notes: This is provisional and should eventually be defined in the PO, not the PPO.

Label: megasporangiate strobilus development stage
Text definition: A strobilus (cone) development  that has as primary participant a megasporangiate strobilus (seed cone).

Label: megasporangiate strobilus unopened stage
Text definition: A megasporangiate strobilus (seed cone) development stage in which the seed cone has not yet reached the megasporangiate strobilus open stage.

Label: megasporangiate strobilus ripe stage
Text definition: A megasporangiate strobilus(seed cone) ripening stage in which the ripening seed cone has completed ripening to the taxon-specific point at which it is widely considered by botanical experts to have seeds that are developed enough to be ready for dispersal.

Label: flower bud breaking stage
Text definition: A flower development stage during which the flower participates in some bud burst stage.

Label: inflorescence bud breaking stage
Text definition: An inflorescence development stage during which the inflorescence participates in some bud burst stage.

Label: megasporangiate strobilus open stage
Text definition: A megasporangiate strobilus (seed cone) development stage, beginning when the scales of a seed cone have opened for pollination and ending when the seeds have fully dehisced.

Label: megasporangiate strobilus developing stage
Text definition: A megasporangiate strobilus (seed cone) open stage in which a seed is developing after fertilization.

Label: megasporangiate strobilus dehiscing stage
Text definition: A megasporangiate strobilus (seed cone) open stage in which this year's seed cones are open and seeds are in the process of abscising or dropping.

Label: megasporangiate strobilus dehisced stage
Text definition: A megasporangiate strobilus (seed cone) development stage in which seeds from the previous year's cones have dehisced but a seed cone is still attached to the plant.
